alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 3:08PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHERN GOSHEN...LARAMIE AND SOUTHEASTERN PLATTE COUNTIES... At 307 PM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Chugwater to 6 miles north of North Cheyenne...and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Strong winds in excess of 45 mph and visibilities less than one half mile. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, La Grange, Burns, Chugwater, South Greeley, Hillsdale, Ranchettes, Hawk Springs Campground, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Warren Af Base, Meriden Rest Area, Gun Barrel, Carpenter, Slater, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas! Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. Travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you.
